document.docAuthor: Motamedinia, Behnam, Skevington, Jeffrey H. & Kelso, Scott
document.masterDocTitle: Revision of Tomosvaryella Aczél (Diptera: Pipunculidae) in the Middle East, with description of 19 new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Revision of Tomosvaryella Aczél (Diptera: Pipunculidae) in the Middle East, with description of 19 new species

bibRefCitation.author: Aczel, M. L.
bibRefCitation.refString: Aczel, M. L. (1944) Die gattung Tomosvaryella Acz. (Dipt.). (Dorylaiden-Studien VIII). Annales Historico-Naturales Musei Nationalis Hungarici, 37, 75 - 130.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis: This species can be recognized by elongated surstyli and epandrium in dorsal view ( Fig. 23A ); long subepandrial sclerite mostly covered by dense hair in ventral view ( Fig. 23B ); unequal gonopods, left is higher than right one in ventral view ( Fig. 23B ); both surstyli normally curved in lateral view ( Fig. 23C‒D ). Based on the shape of the surstyli in dorsal view, this species is related to the kuthyi species group,
Tomosvaryella cyprusensis
sp. nov.
,
T. emaratensis
sp. nov. ,
T. freidbergi
,
T. hispanica
,
T. israelensis
and
T. parakuthyi
. It differs from these species by the shape of surstyli in lateral view, slightly narrow, being smoothly curved ( Fig. 23C‒D ). See diagnosis of
T. emaratensis
sp. nov.
and T. cyprusensis
sp. nov.
for more details.
